SENT.plain: The effects of blood sugar level on transient focal brain ischemia were examined by consecutive diffusion-weighted EPI and (1)H echo planar spectroscopic imaging
A remote-controlled rat intraluminal suture middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO) model was prepared
Animals were divided into three experimental groups: control, 1 g/kg, and 2 g/kg glucose groups (n = 6 for each)
Saline or glucose was infused intraperitoneally 30 min prior to MCAO
The glucose-loaded groups showed increased lactate accumulation and marked decreases in average diffusion coefficient in the ischemic region during 40-min MCAO
These changes were correlated with blood sugar levels at the onset of MCAO
After reperfusion, all rats in the control and 1 g/kg groups recovered from the ischemic changes, but three rats with marked hyperglycemia in the 2 g/kg group showed irreversible changes
The adverse effects of hyperglycemia on transient focal brain ischemia were clearly demonstrated by sequential 2D images
